result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamont R Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lamont R Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Lamont R Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Court waived defendant's appearance. State is in compliance with victim notification.
Discussion held. Defendant has a felony matter (22CF2606) in Branch 28 and will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer.
Court authorizes transfer to Branch 28 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted.   
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 15.
Court authorizes status conference to be held via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Lamont R Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Lamont R Johnson. Attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference. 
This hearing MAY be streamed live on Dacast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/104d9737-ba2f-8811-9083-aed2135824d9
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
